name: SPAM issues and prevention in DXI/EFS

Overview

This article provides comprehensive information on SPAM issues, email authentication methods, and best practices for ensuring email deliverability. It covers various topics including SPF, DKIM, DMARC, whitelisting, blacklisting, and recent changes in email authentication requirements by major email providers.

Information

Email deliverability is crucial for effective communication. This guide focuses on various techniques and protocols to improve email authentication and reduce the likelihood of legitimate emails being marked as spam.

  • General Information
  • SPF (Sender Policy Framework)
  • DKIM (DomainKeys Identified Mail)
  • DMARC (Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting and Conformance)
  • Whitelisting
  • Blacklisting
  • External Mailserver
  • Mail Reputation
  • Gmail and Yahoo Changes (February 2024)

General Information

Before an email appears in the recipient's inbox, it has to overcome several hurdles. The increasing measures for protection against spam can sometimes filter out desired emails. With spam accounting for more than 90 percent of total mail volume, both email providers and recipients are forced to take extensive countermeasures.

To check the IP addresses for mails, refer to the Hurricane Socketlabs MTA Overview.

For official documentation on how to avoid invitations ending up in the spam folder, please refer to the customer-facing Good Mail – Bad Mail: How to Avoid Invitations Ending up in the Spam Folder guide.

SPF (Sender Policy Framework)

SPF is an email authentication method that specifies which mail servers are authorized to send emails on behalf of your domain.

Add the following SPF record to your domain's DNS settings in order to implement SPF checks:

include:_spf.tivian.com

For a detailed breakdown of the IPs included in this SPF record, visit: MX Toolbox SPF Lookup.

Note that using IP addresses instead of FQDN's is also possible, however, not at all recommended, as IP addresses are subject to change.

DKIM (DomainKeys Identified Mail)

DKIM adds a digital signature to your emails that is associated with your domain and used for all outgoing emails.

How to check DKIM

  1. Visit MX Toolbox DKIM Lookup
  2. Enter your domain
  3. Use "tivian" or "qb" as the selector

DMARC (Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting and Conformance)

DMARC is a specification developed to reduce email abuse. It builds upon SPF and DKIM.

How to check DMARC

  1. Visit MX Toolbox DMARC Lookup
  2. Enter your domain in the search field

Note: DMARC is only effective when SPF and DKIM are already set up.

Whitelisting

Whitelists are positive lists that certify a listed sender with a special reputation and ensure preferential treatment of their emails by email providers.

Blacklisting

Blacklisting involves blocking IP addresses of email addresses that have been classified as spammers due to suspicious behavior. These IP addresses are placed on a blacklist and emails from them are not delivered.

External Mailserver

Customers can use their own mail server or mailing infrastructure for sending emails. If customers use their own mail server, you can verify this by:

  1. Finding the following in Globis under 'Modules': use_hurricane_mta hurricane_snailmail_port
  2. On the installation: Options > Mail-Admin > Mail-Report , if the columns Rejected, Not delivered, Not reachable are missing here, then this is also an indication that an external mail server is being used.

How to set up an external mailserver

To set up an external mailserver, the customer needs to provide the following information:

  • Server/Host
  • Port
  • Account/User
  • Password

In some instances, the customer mailserver would require some whitelisting of IP's to allow relaying. In this case, you can refer to Outgoing NAT IP addresses productive environments

Mail Reputation

You can test the reputation of your emails using tools like Mail Tester.

  1. First call up the mail template on the installation: Preview button (top left) > Send test mail and enter the mail address specified by the Mail Tester tool here
  2. Then check the result in the Mail Tester. (The result sometimes takes a while)

Gmail and Yahoo Changes (February 2024)

Starting February 1st, 2024, Gmail and Yahoo will implement mandatory requirements for email authentication and spam prevention. The following was sent to the customers:

Hi,

We hope this message finds you well. We want to bring your attention to critical changes taking place in email authentication and spam prevention protocols by Gmail and Yahoo. Starting from February 1st, 2024, these adjustments will shift from being best practices to mandatory requirements. Non-compliance could lead to email delivery issues for senders.

To ensure uninterrupted email delivery, we recommend immediate action on the following key points:

  1. Authenticate your sending domain: Utilize DKIM and SPF to authenticate your sending domain properly.

  2. Set up DMARC: Implement DMARC to prevent unauthorized entities from impersonating your domain and sending emails.

  3. Maintain a low spam complaint rate: Regularly monitor and manage your spam complaint rate to ensure it remains within acceptable limits.

While Tivian manages numerous best practices on your behalf, as the domain owner or customer overseeing email communication, there are specific actions you need to take. We have conducted assessments on the sender domains associated with your account and identified areas that require attention.

Please have your technical team review the following domains and promptly implement the specified updates to avoid potential issues:

Domain: ……..

  1. Add / include the following Tivian SPF Domain to your SPF record: include:

_spf.tivian.com

  1. Add the DNS record for DKIM: if not already setup, please request specific DKIM keys from domains from our support team:

support@tivian.com

  1. Add the DNS record for DMARC: again, please request this from our support team:

support@tivian.com

Upon completing the necessary changes, kindly raise a support ticket with our team to confirm the adjustments for each domain have been made.

Should you encounter any difficulties or have questions, please don't hesitate to raise a support ticket in the usual manner. We are here to assist you throughout this process.

Your prompt attention to these updates is crucial for maintaining seamless email delivery. We appreciate your cooperation in ensuring the continued success of your email communications.

 

FAQ

What is SPF and how do I implement it?

SPF (Sender Policy Framework) is an email authentication method that specifies which mail servers are authorized to send emails on behalf of your domain. To implement SPF, add the following record to your domain's DNS settings: include:_spf.tivian.com

How can I check if my domain has a DKIM record?

You can check for a DKIM record by using the MX Toolbox DKIM Lookup tool. Enter your domain and use "tivian" or "qb" as the selector.

What changes are Gmail and Yahoo implementing in February 2024?

Starting February 1st, 2024, Gmail and Yahoo will require mandatory email authentication and spam prevention measures. This includes proper DKIM and SPF authentication, DMARC implementation, and maintaining a low spam complaint rate.
